4. The certificate-issuing authority of a Party shall, upon request, provide the competent Administration of the other Party with the results of the quality standards evaluation conducted in accordance with the requirements of Regulation (I/8) of the Convention.

# Article (4)
## Suspension, Withdrawal, or Cancellation of a Certificate or Endorsement of Recognition of a Certificate
The two Parties shall inform each other of any decision to suspend, withdraw, or cancel a certificate issued or recognized by them, stating the reasons therefor, within five (5) working days from the date of the decision.

# Article (5)
## Visitation Procedures Between the Parties
The competent Administration may – after obtaining approval – visit the facilities of the certificate-issuing authority of the other Party and review its procedures, by means of a notification sent by the responsible official in that Administration at least thirty (30) days prior to the date of the visit, either by official letter or via email, to the address specified in Article (2) of this Memorandum, provided that such notification includes the following:
1. The purpose of the visit and the facilities to be visited, provided that the purpose of the visit is limited to reviewing the following:
    (a) Methods of implementing training and certification standards in accordance with the Convention.
    (b) Methods of issuing certificates, endorsements of recognition, training, revalidation, and suspension of certificates.
    (c) Record-keeping mechanisms.
    (d) Methods of implementing medical fitness standards for seafarers.
    (e) Procedures for communication and response to inquiries about certificates and the issuance of recognition documents.
    (f) Provision of course curricula and curricula vitae of instructors and specialists.
    (g) Seafarers' database.
    (h) Methods of establishing and implementing a quality management system.
    (i) Approved maritime training institutions and institutes.
2. The procedures to be audited during the visit.
3. A list of the names of the competent Administration's officials who will conduct the visit.

# Article (6)
## Verification of Certificate Validity
In accordance with the requirements of the Convention, the competent Administration may verify the validity and contents of a certificate through official correspondence or via email, provided that the verification request is responded to by official letter or email within three (3) working days of receiving the request.

# Article (7)
## Certificate Specimens
The certificate-issuing Party shall provide the Administration of the other Party with specimens of the certificates it issues, along with a specimen of the seal with which the certificates are stamped and any amendments thereto.

# Article (8)
## Relationship with Other Laws and Agreements
1. This Memorandum shall not conflict with the national laws of either Party.
2. This Memorandum supersedes any prior memorandum of understanding on this matter between the Parties.
3. This Memorandum and its arrangements shall not supersede the implementation of obligations arising from international, multilateral, or bilateral agreements that have been or will be signed and approved by the Parties.
4. The Parties shall inform each other of any changes in the implementation of this Memorandum or in their national laws that may affect the implementation of this Memorandum.

# Article (9)
## Settlement of Disputes
The Parties shall settle any disputes arising from the application or interpretation of the provisions of this Memorandum amicably through consultations via diplomatic channels.

# Article (10)
## Entry into Force, Amendment, and Termination of the Memorandum
1. This Memorandum shall enter into force on the date of receipt of the last notification by which one Party informs the other Party in writing and through diplomatic channels of the completion of the internal procedures necessary for its entry into force.
2. This Memorandum may be amended by an official letter through diplomatic channels, agreed upon in writing by both Parties, and such amendments shall enter into force as set out in the preceding paragraph.
3. Either Party may terminate or suspend this Memorandum by sending a written notification to the other Party ninety (90) days prior to the date of termination or suspension if one of the following two reasons exists:
    (a) If the certificate-issuing Party is unable to maintain its name on the White List issued by the International Maritime Organization.
    (b) If either Party fails to fulfill its obligations stipulated in this Memorandum.

Done in Kuwait City <orig>مدينة الكويت</orig> on Thursday, 31 October 2024, in two original copies in the Arabic language, both being equally authentic.

# Memorandum of Understanding on the Establishment of a Joint Strategic Dialogue
Between
The State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>, represented by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs <orig>وزارة الخارجية</orig>
And the Italian Republic <orig>الجمهورية الإيطالية</orig>
represented by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation <orig>وزارة الخارجية والتعاون الدولي</orig>.

The State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>, represented by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs <orig>وزارة الخارجية</orig>, and the Italian Republic <orig>الجمهورية الإيطالية</orig>, represented by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation <orig>وزارة الشؤون الخارجية والتعاون الدولي</orig>, hereinafter referred to individually as "the Party" and collectively as "the Parties",
Taking into consideration the Agreement on the Establishment of a Joint Committee for Cooperation between their two governments, concluded in Rome <orig>روما</orig> on 26 November 2009,
Desiring to establish a strategic dialogue, hereinafter referred to as the "Strategic Dialogue," in order to strengthen friendly relations and develop areas of cooperation between them,
And in order to achieve common objectives through the identification and development of initiatives and activities in various fields of common interest, as well as within the framework of specialized working groups,
Have agreed as follows:

## Article One – The Joint Strategic Dialogue
1. The two Parties shall engage in a Joint Strategic Dialogue (hereinafter referred to as "ISD") through regular meetings, with the aim of:
    - Strengthening the existing bilateral relations between the two countries in accordance with Article Two of this Memorandum of Understanding.
    - Discussing international and regional issues of common interest and cooperation within international organizations.
    - Implementing and following up on any agreements, memoranda of understanding, treaties, and cooperation programs signed between the two Parties.
    - Exchanging information, expertise, and consultations between the two Parties.

## Article Two – Sectors
1. Within the framework of the "ISD", the participants shall discuss cooperation in the following areas:
    - Political and diplomatic relations.
    - Development of bilateral relations in sectors such as economy, finance, energy, infrastructure and services, transportation, environmental protection and climate change, private sector cooperation, investments, and trade.
    - Science and technology, with a focus on water management, space, agriculture and food security, health, and cybersecurity.
    - Defense and security issues of common interest from a regional perspective;
    - Combating terrorism and preventing extremism;
    - Implementing and following up on international agreements, memoranda of understanding, treaties, and cooperation programs signed between the participants.

– Culture and education, including the promotion of language and literature, university cooperation, archaeology, tourism, sports, and youth;
– Coordination of positions in multinational forums and nominations in international organizations;
– Any other issue of mutual interest.

## Article Three – ISD Coordination
1. The ISD shall be chaired by the Ministers of Foreign Affairs of the two countries or their delegates.
2. The ISD shall be organized at three different levels:
   a. ISD Working Groups, co-chaired by senior officials from both Parties.
   b. An ISD Board Meeting, co-chaired by the Ministers of Foreign Affairs or their delegates (hereinafter referred to as "ISD – MOFA");
   c. A Follow-up Body.
3. The Parties shall hold the ISD–MOFA meeting in principle once a year in the capital of the host country on a rotating basis. The date and venue of the meeting shall be agreed upon through diplomatic channels.

## Article Four – ISD Working Groups
1. ISD Working Groups shall be established during the first ISD–MOFA session in accordance with the main areas of mutual interest. They shall remain in place until otherwise agreed upon by the Participants.
2. Any amendment to the number and mandate of the ISD Dialogue Working Groups shall be approved by the ISD – MOFA at the first meeting after the amendment is proposed.
3. The Working Groups may meet either in person or virtually.
4. Each ISD Working Group shall be co-chaired by senior officials from both Participants.
The co-chairs of the ISD Working Group shall agree on the agenda of the group's meeting and the schedule of meetings.
5. Representatives of the public administration and the private sector may participate in the meetings of the ISD Working Groups if the need arises.
6. The ISD Working Group shall produce a report (action plan or action points) to be submitted to the ISD – MOFA for approval and endorsement.

## Article Five – ISD Follow-up Committee
1. Following the endorsement of the action plans or action points by the ISD–MOFA, the Parties shall establish an ISD Follow-up Committee, co-chaired by senior officials from the Ministries of Foreign Affairs of each of the Parties and composed of representatives from the relevant sectoral departments. The ISD – Follow-up Committee shall meet either in person or virtually.
2. The ISD Follow-up Committee shall be tasked with monitoring the implementation of the action plan or action points.
3. All communications related to the convening and coordination of the ISD Follow-up Committee shall be sent through diplomatic channels.

## Article Six – Costs
The activities provided for in this Memorandum of Understanding shall be carried out by the Parties in accordance with their available ordinary budget without any additional costs to the budgets of the State of Kuwait and the Italian Republic. The sending Party shall bear the costs of travel, accommodation, and medical care for the members of the delegations in accordance with the legislation of the host country.

## Article Seven – Communication
1. The Parties shall maintain the confidentiality of the ISD deliberations, procedures, and/or outcomes unless they arrange otherwise by mutual consent.
2. Within the framework of the ISD, the Parties may decide to issue joint statements, joint press releases for joint announcements, the content of which may then be used by each Participant without the specific consent of the other Participant.

## Article Eight – Applicable Law and Personal Data
1. This Memorandum of Understanding does not constitute an international agreement that may give rise to rights and obligations under international law. This Memorandum of Understanding shall be applied in full compliance with Kuwaiti and Italian legislation as well as applicable international law, and, for the Italian Party, the obligations arising from Italy's membership in the European Union.
2. In order to ensure the confidentiality of personal data exchanged for the implementation of this Memorandum of Understanding, each Party undertakes not to transfer such data to third parties or otherwise process it in a manner inconsistent with the agreed purpose without the prior written consent of the other Party.

## Article Nine – Disputes
Any dispute concerning the interpretation and/or implementation of this Memorandum of Understanding shall be settled amicably through consultations and/or negotiations via diplomatic channels.

## Article Ten – Validity and Termination
1. This Memorandum of Understanding shall enter into force on the date of receipt of the written notification by which the Kuwaiti Party informs the Italian Party of the completion of its internal constitutional procedures required for its implementation.
2. This Memorandum of Understanding shall remain in effect until one of the Parties notifies the other of its intention to terminate it. In such a case, this Memorandum of Understanding shall cease to be in effect six (6) months after notifying the other Party, unless otherwise arranged.

# MEMORANDUM OF UNDERSTANDING ON ESTABLISHING A JOINT STRATEGIC DIALOGUE BETWEEN THE STATE OF KUWAIT REPRESENTED BY THE MINISTRY OF FOREIGN AFFAIRS AND THE ITALIAN REPUBLIC REPRESENTED BY THE MINISTRY OF FOREIGN AFFAIRS AND INTERNATIONAL COOPERATION

The Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the State of Kuwait and the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation of the Italian Republic, hereinafter referred to individually as "Participant" and jointly as the "Participants,"
TAKING INTO ACCOUNT the Agreement Establishing a Joint Committee for Cooperation between their respective Governments, done at Rome on November 26th, 2009;
DESIRING to establish a joint strategic dialogue in order to strengthen friendly relations and to develop areas of cooperation between them, and in order to achieve common goals through the identification and development of joint initiatives and activities in different fields of shared interests, also in the framework of dedicated working groups, have entered into the following Memorandum of Understanding (MoU):

## Article 1– Joint Strategic Dialogue
The Participants will engage in a Joint Strategic Dialogue (hereinafter referred to as "JSD") through regular meetings, with a view to:
- Strengthening the existing bilateral relations between the two Countries, in accordance with Article 2 of this MoU;
- Discussing international and regional issues of common interest and the joint cooperation within International Organizations;
- Implementing and following up any agreements, memoranda of understanding, treaties and cooperation programs signed between the Participants;
- Exchanging information, experiences, and consultations between the Participants.

## Article 2 – Sectors
Within the JSD the Participants will discuss cooperation in the following fields:
- political and diplomatic relations;
- development of bilateral relations in sectors such as economy, finance, energy, infrastructures and services, transports, environmental protection and climate change, private sectors collaboration, investments, trade;
- science and technology, with a focus on water management, space, agriculture and food security, health, and cyber-security;
- defence and security issues of shared concern, also in a regional perspective;
- the fight against terrorism and the prevention of radicalization;
- implementation and follow-up of international agreements, memoranda of understanding, treaties and cooperation programs signed between the Participants;
- culture and education, including especially language and literature promotion, university cooperation, archaeology, tourism, sport, and youth;
- coordination of respective positions in multinational fora and candidatures in International Organizations;

## Article 3 – Format of the JSD
1. The JSD will be jointly chaired by the Ministers of Foreign Affairs of both Participants or their delegates.
2. The JSD will be organized in three different levels:
   a. The JSD Working Groups, jointly chaired by senior officials of the Participants;
   b. The JSD Board Meeting, jointly chaired by the Ministers of Foreign Affairs or their delegates (hereinafter referred to as "JSD–MoFA);"
   c. The Follow-up Commission.
3. The Participants will convene the JSD–MoFA tentatively once a year in the capital of the host country on an alternating basis. The date and venue of the meeting will be agreed upon via diplomatic channels.

## Article 4 – JSD Working Groups
1. The JSD Working Groups will be established during the first JSD–MoFA session according to the main areas of mutual interest. They will remain in place until differently agreed upon by the Participants.
2. Any amendment of the number and the mandate of the JSD Working Groups will be approved by JSD–MoFA on the first meeting following the modification proposal.
3. The Working Groups could be convened either in person or in virtual modality.
4. Each JSD Working Group will be jointly chaired by senior officials of both Participants. The JSD Working Group Chairpersons will agree on the agenda for the Group meeting and the calendar of meetings.
5. Representatives of Public Administration and private sector may participate in the JSD Working Groups meetings if the need arises.
6. The JSD Working Group will produce a report (Action Plan or Action Points) that will be submitted to the JSD–MoFA for approval and endorsement.

## Article 5 -JSD Follow-up Committee
1. Following the endorsement of the Action Plans or Action Points by the JSD- MoFA, the Participants will create a JSD Follow-Up Committee, jointly chaired by senior officials from the Foreign Ministries of both Participants and composed of representatives from concerned sectoral Administrations. The JSD -Follow-Up Committee will meet either in person or in virtual modality.
2. The JSD Follow-Up Committee will be tasked to monitor the implementation of the Action Plan or Action Points.
3. All communication regarding the tasks and coordination of the JSD Follow-Up Committee will be transmitted via diplomatic channels.

## Article 6 – Costs
The activities set forth in this Memorandum of Understanding will be implemented by the Participants according to their ordinary budget availability without any additional costs for the State budgets of the State of Kuwait and the Italian Republic. Travel costs, accommodation, medical care for members of delegations will be borne by the sending Participant consistently with hosting country’s legislation.

## Article 7- Communication
1. The Participants will keep JSD deliberations, proceedings and/or outcomes confidential unless they arrange otherwise by mutual consent.
2. In the framework of the JSD, the Participants may decide to issue joint statements, joint press releases or joint announcements, the content of which can be afterwards used by each Participant without specific approval of the other Participant.

## Article 8– Applicable Law and Personal Data
1. This MoU does not constitute an international agreement which may lead to rights and obligations under international law. This MoU will be applied in full compliance with the Kuwaiti and Italian legislations, as well as applicable international law, and, as for the Italian Participant, the obligations arising from Italy’s membership of the European Union.
2. In order to ensure the confidentiality of the personal data exchanged for the implementation of this MoU, each Participant undertakes not to transfer those data to third parties or otherwise process them in a manner that is incompatible with the agreed purpose without the prior written consent of the other Participant.

## Article 9 – Divergences
Any divergence concerning the interpretation and/or implementation of this MoU will be settled amicably through consultations and/or negotiations via diplomatic channels. For the Italian Republic represented by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation

# Article 10 – Validity and termination

1. This Memorandum of Understanding will take effect at the date of the receipt of the written notification by which the Kuwaiti Participant informs the Italian Participant of the completion of its internal constitutional procedures required for its implementation.
2. This MoU will remain valid until one of the Participants notifies the other of its intention to terminate it. In such event this MoU will cease to have effect six(6) months after the notification to the other Participant, unless otherwise arranged.
3. This MoU may be consensually amended in writing by the Participants. The amendments will take effect at the date of the receipt of the written notification by which the Kuwaiti Participant informs the Italian Participant of the completion of its internal constitutional procedures required for its implementation.
4. The termination of the present MoU will not affect standing tasks, until completion, unless otherwise consensually decided by the Participants, nor will it affect the validity or the duration of any separate arrangement made under this MoU.

Signed in Rome on 4t July 2023, in two originals, each in the Arabic, Italian, and English languages, all texts being equally authentic. In case of any divergence, the English text will prevail.

- The Amiri Decree issued on July 17, 1973, establishing the National Council for Culture, Arts, and Letters.
- Decree No. 146 of 1991, affiliating the National Council for Culture, Arts, and Letters with the Minister of Information.
- Law No. 3 of 2006 regarding Printing and Publishing, its amendments, and its executive regulations.
- Law No. 61 of 2007 regarding Audio-Visual Media and its executive regulations.
- Law No. 21 of 2015 regarding Children's Rights.
- Law No. 8 of 2016 regulating Electronic Media and its executive regulations.
- Law No. 75 of 2019 issuing the Law on Copyright and Related Rights.
- Council of Ministers Decision No. (1018) issued on 8/3/1999 regarding the approval to establish the State Appreciation Award.
- Council of Ministers Decision No. (654) issued on 4/5/2015 determining the value of the State Appreciation and Encouragement Awards in Arts, Letters, and Social and Human Sciences for creators from the citizens of Kuwait.
- Council of Ministers Decision No. (506) made on 22/4/2025 approving the change of the name of the State Encouragement Award in Arts, Letters, and Social and Human Sciences, as stated in the Council of Ministers Decision from its meeting No. (29/88) held on 12/6/1988, to become (the State Award for Creativity in Arts, Letters, and Social and Human Sciences).

And based on the requirements of the public interest,

**Decided**

### (Article One)
### Definitions

For the purposes of applying the provisions of this decision, the following words and phrases shall have the meanings indicated next to each:
- The Minister: The Minister of Information and Chairman of the National Council for Culture, Arts, and Letters.
- The Council: The National Council for Culture, Arts, and Letters.
- The Secretary-General: of the National Council for Culture, Arts, and Letters.
- The Committee: The Higher Committee for the State Appreciation Award and the State Award for Creativity.
- The Award: The State Appreciation Award in Culture, Arts, and Letters, and the State Award for Creativity in Arts, Letters, and Social and Human Sciences.

## Chapter One
### (Article Two)
### The State Appreciation Award in Culture, Arts, and Letters

The award is granted to creators from the citizens of Kuwait in honor and appreciation of their overall cultural contributions in the following fields:
1- Social Sciences.
2- Poetry, short stories, novels, and children's literature.
3- Literary, critical, linguistic, heritage, and translation studies.
4- Visual, theatrical, musical, and other arts.
5- Media and electronic communication related to culture and arts.
6- Cultural services.

### (Article Three)
### Award Provisions and Conditions

1- Must be of Kuwaiti nationality.
2- Must be of good conduct and reputable character.
3- The award is granted to citizens of Kuwait who have provided distinguished services and outstanding creations in the fields of culture, arts, and letters.
4- The award is granted annually to a maximum of three Kuwaiti creators who meet the award's conditions, in honor and appreciation of their overall cultural contributions.
5- The Appreciation Award is granted only once to a person during their lifetime.
6- If the nominee has previously received the State Award for Creativity, they may not be nominated for the State Appreciation Award until five calendar years have passed.
7- Their work or contributions must be of high cultural, artistic, or literary value that has enriched cultural, artistic, and intellectual life locally, in the Arab world, or globally.
8- Must not be an employee in any sector of the National Council for Culture, Arts, and Letters.
9- The Committee shall select three nominees for the award, with a fourth name as a reserve, and then submit the final list to the Minister of Information for approval or amendment.

### (Article Four)
### Nomination for the State Appreciation Award

1- The Committee shall select whomever it deems suitable to receive the award, provided that it submits a detailed report on the reasons and justifications for the nomination.
2- Governmental and private scientific bodies concerned with social sciences and culture, or with letters, media, or modern technological communications related to culture and arts.
For example (Kuwait University <orig>جامعة الكويت</orig> – The Public Authority for Applied Education and Training <orig>الهيئة العامة للتعليم التطبيقي والتدريب</orig> – Public benefit associations and other relevant entities), provided that nomination applications are submitted to the General Secretariat of the Council, accompanied by a report explaining the reasons and justifications for the nomination request.

3- Personal nominations are not accepted.
4- The nomination for the award must be within the scope of the nominating body's specialization and must be limited to only one nominee for any of the specialized branches. Any nomination made otherwise shall be considered void.
5- Nominations received from governmental and non-governmental bodies and institutions shall be referred to the Committee for review after all formal requirements have been met, including detailed nomination justifications and clear rationales.
6- The General Secretariat of the Council <orig>الأمانة العامة للمجلس</orig> shall submit a comprehensive nomination for the award to the competent committee, providing all details related to the nominee and the necessary nomination justifications, for its consideration and opinion.

## (Article Five)
### Value of the Award
The winner of the award shall receive the amount allocated for it pursuant to the Council of Ministers <orig>مجلس الوزراء</orig> Decision No. (3837) issued on March 24, 2013, as amended by the Council of Ministers <orig>مجلس الوزراء</orig> Decision No. 654 of 2015, in the amount of (20,000) Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>, in addition to a commemorative shield and a certificate of appreciation.

# Chapter Two
## The State Award for Creativity in Arts, Literature, and Social and Human Sciences

## (Article Six)
### Fields of Arts
First: Fields of Arts
This pertains to the following:
1- Fine and Applied Arts (Painting)
2- Fine and Applied Arts (Sculpture - Engraving - Ceramics)
3- Television and Cinema Acting
4- Theatrical Acting
5- Television Directing
6- Theatrical Directing
7- Cinema Directing
8- Musical Composition
9- Critical Studies of Fine Arts
10- Critical Studies of Musical Arts

Second: Field of Literature
This pertains to the following:
1- Poetry
2- Short Story
3- Novel
4- Theatrical Script
5- Children's Literature (Theater - Stories - Poems)
6- Linguistic, Literary, and Critical Studies
7- Verification of Arab Heritage
8- Translation into the Arabic Language

Third: Field of Social and Human Sciences
This pertains to the following:
1- Historical, Archaeological, and Popular Tradition Studies of the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>
2- Philosophy
3- Sociology
4- Education
5- Psychology
6- History and Archaeology
7- Geography
8- Economics
9- Political Science

## (Article Seven)
### Nominating Bodies for the Award
1- Relevant governmental and non-governmental scientific, academic, cultural, and artistic bodies in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>.
2- Personal nomination, whereby any individual has the right to submit their work to win this award.

## (Article Eight)
### Conditions and Procedures for Applying for the Award
1- The applicant must be of Kuwaiti nationality.
2- The nominee must fill out the form designated for this purpose within the specified and announced timeframe.
3- The work or idea must be new of its kind and unprecedented, and the work must be capable of inspiring others. It must also meet the following criteria for creativity:
    a. Originality and distinction.
    b. Characterized by intellectual and symbolic depth.
    c. Creates a state of interaction with balance and societal impact.
4- The author of the work must not have obtained an academic degree (Master's or Doctorate) for it.
5- No more than five calendar years must have passed since the work's completion or publication at the date of the announcement.
6- The applicant for the award must provide the Council with samples of their work for review, if any, as well as their curriculum vitae.
7- Works nominated for the award must have a deposit certificate from the National Library of Kuwait <orig>مكتبة الكويت الوطنية</orig>, for works to which the conditions for obtaining a deposit certificate apply.
8- The publications must have a circulation permit from the Ministry of Information <orig>وزارة الإعلام</orig>.
9- The publications must be written in Modern Standard Arabic.
10- Joint works are accepted, provided that all co-authors are Kuwaiti citizens.
11- A person nominated for the award by a third party must provide the Council with written consent from the individual concerned.

12- To be nominated for the Children's Literature Award, the candidate must submit at least three publications, indicating in each the age group it is intended for.
13- Winners from previous years in any of the award's fields are prohibited from applying for the award until five calendar years have passed, and they must apply in a different category from the one in which they won.
14- The applicant for the award must be of good conduct and reputation, must not have been previously convicted of a felony unless rehabilitated, and must have a criminal record certificate free of prior convictions.
15- Must not be an employee of the National Council for Culture, Arts, and Letters <orig>المجلس الوطني للثقافة والفنون والآداب</orig>.

## (Article Nine)
### Announcement of the Award
- The award shall be announced in all types of media, and applications shall be submitted during the period specified in the announcement for nominations.

# Chapter Three
## Work of the Higher Committee for the State Appreciation Award and the State Award for Creativity
### (Article Ten)
- The Committee shall be formed by a decision of the Minister. The decision shall specify the chairman and members of the Committee from among prominent cultural, literary, and scientific figures with experience and specialization from outside the Council. The rapporteur of the Committee shall be an employee of the competent sector at the National Council for Culture, Arts, and Letters <orig>المجلس الوطني للثقافة والفنون والآداب</orig>. The Committee shall operate with complete independence in accordance with this decision.

### (Article Eleven)
1- The Committee shall convene at the invitation of its chairman, and all its meetings and deliberations shall be confidential.
2- The Culture Sector at the Council shall handle the administrative work and follow-up of the Committee.
3- The Committee's meetings shall be valid with the attendance of more than half of its members.
4- The Committee shall determine the fields for the State Award for Creativity in each of its cycles.
5- The Committee's decisions shall be made by a majority of those present. The decision to grant the Appreciation Award shall be issued with the approval of two-thirds of the Committee members present.
6- The Committee shall review the nominations submitted to it and verify their compliance with the conditions stipulated in this decision.
7- The Committee has the right to exclude works that do not meet the level of creativity and merit or that do not comply with the award's conditions, before presenting them to the arbitrators.
8- The Committee shall select arbitrators for the State Award for Creativity from among prominent specialists in the announced fields. The Committee has the right to seek the assistance of arbitrators from inside and outside the State of Kuwait based on a proposal submitted to the Council.
9- The arbitration decision shall be adopted and become effective, and it shall be presented to the Committee for its approval.
10- The Committee's decisions shall be considered effective after their minutes are approved by the Minister.
11- Reviewing and responding to grievances and complaints related to the State Award for Creativity and the State Appreciation Award.
12- Selecting the cultural, literary, and artistic figures who deserve to receive the State Appreciation Award in accordance with the regulations stipulated in this decision.
13- The Committee members shall abide by the provisions of Law No. 3 of 2006 regarding Publications and Publishing and its amendments and executive regulations, Law No. 61 of 2007 regarding Audio-Visual Media and its executive regulations, Law No. 21 of 2015 regarding Child Rights, Law No. 8 of 2016 regulating Electronic Media and its executive regulations, and Law No. 75 regarding the issuance of the Copyright and Neighboring Rights Law.

# Chapter Four
## Arbitration for the State Award for Creativity in Arts, Literature, and Social and Human Sciences
### (Article Twelve)
### Formation of Committees and Arbitration Mechanism
- The Committee shall form arbitration committees of prominent specialists and experts in the specific fields announced each year. Each committee shall study and evaluate the literary and artistic works of the applicants on the basis of objectivity, scientific rigor, and accuracy, taking into account the following:
1- The arbitrator shall be committed to determining the results in accordance with the awards specified for the fields by the Committee.
2- The arbitrator has the right to grant awards jointly. In the event the award is granted to more than two persons, the share of any one of them must not be less than half of the amount allocated for the award.
3- The arbitrator has the right to withhold some awards for which the creativity criteria stipulated in this decision are not met.
4- The number of members in each arbitration committee shall not be less than three and not more than five.
5- Each arbitrator shall review and evaluate the works individually and confidentially, without any arbitrator knowing the other members of the same arbitration committee.
6- Each arbitrator shall prepare a detailed confidential report that includes the method used to evaluate the winning work, explaining the merits and significance of the winning production. As for works that do not meet the criteria stipulated in this decision, a confidential report shall be submitted to the Secretary-General briefly stating the reasons for the work's exclusion.
7- The arbitration committee member (the arbitrator) must recuse themselves from their task if they, or one of their first or second-degree relatives, apply for an award.
8- If an arbitration committee member is selected from outside Kuwait, the arbitrator shall send the written report (in accordance with paragraph 6 of Article 12 stipulated in this decision) to the Secretary-General confidentially, either by express mail or email.
9- Members of the arbitration committees shall be bound by the condition of absolute confidentiality in their work, and shall not disclose their membership in the committee or reveal any of their opinions, the results of the arbitration of the works submitted for the competition, or the identity of the participants.

### (Article Thirteen)
## Financial Remuneration for Arbitration Committees

### First:
Arbitration for awards in the following fields:
1- Critical Studies in Fine Arts.
2- Critical Studies in Musical Arts.
3- Poetry.
4- The Novel.
5- The Short Story.
6- The Theatrical Script.
7- Children's Literature (theater – stories – poems).
8- Translation into the Arabic Language.
9- Linguistic, Literary, and Critical Studies.
10- Verification of Arab Heritage.
11- Historical, Archaeological, and Folkloric Studies of the State of Kuwait.
12- Philosophy.
13- Education.
14- Sociology.
15- Geography.
16- Psychology.
17- Economics.
18- Political Science.
19- History and Archaeology.
- The arbitrator in each of the preceding fields shall be granted a financial remuneration of three hundred Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>, equivalent to one thousand US dollars, for the first three works, with an additional one hundred Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>, equivalent to three hundred US dollars, for each additional work arbitrated, up to a maximum of seven hundred Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>, equivalent to two thousand five hundred US dollars.

### Second:
1- Fine and Applied Arts (sculpture – engraving – ceramics – painting).
2- Theatrical Acting.
3- Television and Cinematic Acting.
4- Theatrical Directing.
5- Cinematic Directing.
6- Television Directing.
7- Musical Composition.
- The arbitrator in this field shall be granted remuneration of three hundred Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>, equivalent to one thousand US dollars, for the first five works, with an additional fifty dinars, equivalent to one hundred and fifty US dollars, for each additional work arbitrated, up to a maximum of six hundred Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>, equivalent to two thousand US dollars.
- The television series category is an exception, where the arbitrator is granted one hundred Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>, equivalent to three hundred US dollars, for every thirty episodes arbitrated.

### (Article Fourteen)
## General Provisions

1- The Council shall be responsible for announcing the names of the winners, informing them thereof, and notifying them of the date of the official ceremony held for this occasion.
2- The winner in each field of the award shall be granted the amount allocated to them pursuant to the Council of Ministers <orig>مجلس الوزراء</orig> Decision No. 3837 issued on 24/3/2013 and amended by the Council of Ministers <orig>مجلس الوزراء</orig> Decision No. 654 of 2015, in addition to a certificate of appreciation and a commemorative shield for the award.
3- Applicants for the Creativity Award must obtain a certificate of deposit for the work or artistic creation from the National Library of Kuwait <orig>مكتبة الكويت الوطنية</orig> or a circulation permit from the Ministry of Information <orig>وزارة الإعلام</orig>.
4- The production, artistic creation, or other works must not violate relevant laws.

### (Article Fifteen)
- Any decision that contradicts the provisions of this decision is hereby repealed.

### (Article Sixteen)
- The competent authorities shall implement this decision. It shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> and shall come into effect from the date of its publication.

Minister of Information and Culture
President of the National Council for Culture, Arts, and Letters <orig>المجلس الوطني للثقافة والفنون والآداب</orig>
Abdulrahman Badah Al-Mutairi <orig>عبدالرحمن بداح المطيري</orig>

## Administrative Decision No. (1146) of 2025

The Undersecretary of the Ministry of Commerce and Industry
Having perused:
- Decree-Law No. (43) of 1964 regarding importation and its executive regulations.
- And Decree-Law No. (10) of 1979 regarding the supervision of trade in goods, the pricing of some of them, and artisanal works and the pricing of some of them, and its amendments.
- And Decree-Law No. (68) of 1980 issuing the Commercial Law, and its amending laws.

- And the letter from the Public Authority for Food and Nutrition <orig>الهيئة العامة للغذاء والتغذية</orig> No. (1475) dated 23/06/2025 regarding the recommendations of meeting No. (6/2025).

# Administrative Decision No. (1149) of 2025

**Undersecretary of the Ministry of Commerce and Industry**

**Having reviewed:**
- Decree-Law No. (43) of 1964 concerning importation and its executive regulations.
- And upon Decree-Law No. (10) of 1979 regarding the supervision of trade in goods, the pricing of some of them, and artisanal works and the pricing of some of them, and its amendments.
- And upon Decree-Law No. (68) of 1980 promulgating the Commercial Law, and its amending laws.
- And upon Decree No. (191) of 2015 concerning the organization of the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>.
- And upon Ministerial Resolution No. (216) of 2014 issuing the Executive Regulations for Law No. (117) of 2013, which amended some provisions of Decree-Law No. (10) of 1979.
- And upon Ministerial Resolution No. (43) of 2025 concerning the delegation of certain powers to the Undersecretary of the Ministry.
- And upon the letter of the Public Authority for Food and Nutrition <orig>الهيئة العامة للغذاء والتغذية</orig> No. (1475) dated 23/6/2025 regarding the recommendations of meeting No. (2025/6).
- And based on the requirements of the public interest.

**It is decided**

### Article One
To lift the ban on the import of all types of poultry meat (fresh - chilled - frozen - processed), its derivatives, and its products, as well as table eggs, from New Zealand, which was imposed due to the outbreak of highly pathogenic avian influenza.

### Article Two
All competent authorities, each within its jurisdiction, shall implement this decision. It shall come into force from the date of its issuance and shall be published in the Official Gazette.

**Undersecretary of the Ministry of Commerce and Industry**

Has decided the following:

Book Ten (Disclosure and Transparency), Book Eleven (Dealing in Securities), and Book Twelve (Listing Rules) of the Executive Regulations of Law No. (7) of 2010 regarding the Establishment of the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> and Regulation of Securities Activities, and their amendments, shall be amended in accordance with Appendix No. (1) of this Decision.

 Adopting the company's general objectives, strategies, plans, and policies, including, at a minimum, the following:
    a- The company's comprehensive strategy and main action plans, and their review and guidance.
    b- The company's optimal capital structure and its financial objectives.
    c- A clear policy for distributing profits of all kinds, whether in cash or in kind, in a manner that serves the interests of the shareholders and the company.
    d- Performance objectives and monitoring the implementation and overall performance of the company.
    e- The company's organizational and functional structures and conducting periodic reviews thereof.
2. Approving the annual estimated budgets and adopting the interim and annual financial statements.
3. Supervising the company's main capital expenditures, and the acquisition and disposal of assets.
4. Ensuring the company's compliance with policies and procedures that guarantee its adherence to the applicable internal systems and regulations.
5. Ensuring the accuracy and integrity of the data and information that must be disclosed, in accordance with the applicable disclosure and transparency policies and systems.
6. Establishing effective communication channels that allow the company's shareholders to be continuously and periodically informed about the company's various activities and any material developments.
7. Forming specialized committees emanating from it in accordance with a charter that clarifies the committee's term, powers, and responsibilities, and how the Board will supervise it. The formation decision shall also include naming the members and defining their tasks, rights, and duties. This is in addition to evaluating the performance and work of these committees and their principal members.
8. Ensuring that the company's approved policies and regulations are transparent and clear in a way that facilitates the decision-making process, achieves the principles of good governance, and separates the powers and authorities between the Board of Directors and the Executive Management. In this regard, the Board must do the following:
    a- Adopting and developing the internal regulations and systems related to the company's work, and the subsequent definition of tasks, competencies, duties, and responsibilities among the different organizational levels.
    b- Adopting a policy for delegating and executing the tasks assigned to the Executive Management.
9. Defining the authorities to be delegated to the Executive Management, the decision-making procedures, and the duration of the delegation. The Board shall also specify the matters for which it retains the authority to decide, and the Executive Management shall submit periodic reports on its exercise of the delegated authorities.
10. Monitoring and supervising the performance of the members of the Executive Management, and ensuring that they perform all the tasks assigned to them. The Board of Directors must do the following:
    a- Ensuring that the Executive Management operates in accordance with the policies and regulations approved by the Board of Directors.
    b- Holding periodic meetings with the Executive Management to discuss the course of business and any obstacles and problems it faces, as well as to review and discuss important information related to the company's activity.
    c- Setting performance standards for the Executive Management that are consistent with the company's objectives and strategy.
11. Determining the remuneration tiers to be granted to employees, such as the fixed remuneration tier, the performance- and long-term risk-linked remuneration tier, and the share-based remuneration tier.
12. Appointing or dismissing any member of the Executive Management, including the Chief Executive Officer and the positions that report directly to him in the company's organizational structure, and ensuring that the conditions mentioned in the provisions of Article (9-3) and the instructions contained in Appendix No. (3) (Mechanism for Applying the Special Conditions for Integrity and Financial Soundness Standards to Board Members and Executive Management of Unlicensed Listed Companies) of the Fifteenth Book (Corporate Governance) of these regulations are met.

# Attachment No. (2)
## Appendix No. 22 (Client's Acknowledgment of Understanding the Nature of Investment in the Emerging Companies Market)
Client's Acknowledgment of Understanding the Nature of Investment in the Emerging Companies Market
(Name of Issue Manager or Securities Broker) confirms that this market may not be suitable for the average client. As an average client, it is strongly recommended that you review all details and aspects related to the investment opportunities available in the Emerging Companies Market, and seek the assistance of an investment advisor licensed by the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> to ensure the suitability of this opportunity, and specifically this type of investment, for your investment objectives and risk tolerance.
By signing this document, you acknowledge and agree that investing in the Emerging Companies Market is an investment of a special nature and is subject to high-level risks. These risks include, but are not limited to, the following:
1. Loss of the entire invested capital.
2. Lack of liquidity.
3. The possibility of a long-term investment.

This resolution shall be effective from the date of its publication in the Official Gazette, and the concerned authorities shall implement it, each within its jurisdiction.

**Acting Director General of the Public Authority for Industry**

Issued on: June 24, 2025 AD

**Minister of State for Housing Affairs**

2- Breeding and training of racehorses and camels by hunting and equestrian clubs and camel clubs.
3- Date palm nursery plots in the Al-Abdali <orig>العبدلي</orig> and Al-Wafra <orig>الوفرة</orig> areas.
As follows:
First: Agricultural Areas (Al-Wafra <orig>الوفرة</orig> – Al-Abdali <orig>العبدلي</orig> – Sulaibiya <orig>الصليبية</orig>): –
1- Building Percentages:
a- The permitted building percentage is 10% of the plot area, with a maximum of (10,000 m2), and includes the following buildings: –
1. Family residence and rest house for the plot owner with a total built-up area not exceeding (1000 m2), including the ground and first floors combined.
2. Laborer housing and a guard's room with an area not exceeding (2000 m2).
3. Seed, fertilizer, and produce collection store with an area not exceeding (2750 m2).
4. Machinery store and workshop with an area not exceeding (1000 m2).
5. Addition of water tanks with a total area not exceeding (500 m2).
6. Cold storage facilities with an area not exceeding (2750 m2).
7. Barns with a total area not exceeding (2000 m2).
b- Construction of greenhouses is permitted up to a percentage not exceeding 80% of the plot area, and they shall be covered with lightweight materials.
c- Drilling one or more artesian water wells is permitted, provided that approval is obtained from the Public Authority for Agriculture Affairs and Fish Resources <orig>الهيئة العامة لشؤون الزراعة والثروة السمكية</orig>.
d- The building may not be used for any purpose other than that for which the plot is designated.
e- An area for garbage container collection must be allocated within the holding's boundaries, adjacent to the fence on the side of a service street. It must be aesthetically fenced to a height not exceeding (2 m) to facilitate garbage collection and removal. Its area shall be determined according to the number of containers, which is directly proportional to the holding's area. It must have an entrance from within the holding and an entrance from outside, in accordance with the requirements of the concerned authorities, and it shall not be calculated as part of the total building percentage.
2- Heights:
a- All buildings shall be single-story only and made of lightweight materials or reinforced concrete. The family residence and rest house are permitted to be two stories (ground and first) only.
b- The maximum height of buildings is as follows: –
- Family residence and rest house for the plot owner, consisting of a ground and first floor, with a maximum height of (9 m).
- Workshop and stores of all types, with a maximum height of (10 m).
- Laborer housing and guard's room, with a maximum height of (5 m).
3- Building Setbacks:
The setback shall not be less than (5 m) from all sides of the plot's boundaries, except for the area designated for garbage container collection and the guard's room and its facilities, which may be attached to one of the facades.
4- Required Documents: –
a- A lease contract from the State Properties Department <orig>إدارة أملاك الدولة</orig>.
b- A valid rent receipt.
c- Submission of a plan approved by the Public Authority for Agriculture Affairs and Fish Resources <orig>الهيئة العامة لشؤون الزراعة والثروة السمكية</orig> through an engineering office licensed by the Municipality.
d- Written approval from the Public Authority for Agriculture Affairs and Fish Resources <orig>الهيئة العامة لشؤون الزراعة والثروة السمكية</orig>.
e- Approval of the plans by the General Fire Force <orig>قوة الإطفاء العام</orig>.
f- Electricity shall not be connected to the buildings until a letter is provided from the Public Authority for Agriculture Affairs and Fish Resources <orig>الهيئة العامة لشؤون الزراعة والثروة السمكية</orig>.
Second: Cattle Breeding and Milk Production Farms in all areas of Kuwait <orig>الكويت</orig>: –
1- Building Percentages: –
a- Building is permitted at varying percentages of the plot area, distributed as follows: –
1. Concentrated and milled feed stores and a feed crushing unit at a percentage of 5%.
2. Repair workshop and spare parts stores at a percentage of 1%.
3. The building for automatic milking machines and their accessories at a percentage of 3%.
4. 10% of the land area is allocated for laborer housing, administrative buildings, and their accessories. A veterinary clinic and a family residence for the plot owner may be established within this area, provided that the area of the family residence for the plot owner does not exceed (1000 m2).
5. The remaining area shall be used for the purpose for which the plot is designated (cattle breeding and milk production), provided that these areas include various barns for cattle breeding according to the requirements and specifications of the Public Authority for Agriculture Affairs and Fish Resources <orig>الهيئة العامة لشؤون الزراعة والثروة السمكية</orig>.
b- The plot may not be used for any purpose other than that for which it is designated and according to the requirements of the Public Authority for Agriculture Affairs and Fish Resources <orig>الهيئة العامة لشؤون الزراعة والثروة السمكية</orig>.
c- Underground water tanks are permitted, provided that the necessary insulation is installed to prevent water leakage.
d- Drilling one or more artesian water wells is permitted, provided that approval is obtained from the Public Authority for Agriculture Affairs and Fish Resources <orig>الهيئة العامة لشؤون الزراعة والثروة السمكية</orig>.
e- An area for garbage container collection must be allocated within the holding's boundaries, adjacent to the fence on the side of a service street. It must be aesthetically fenced to a height not exceeding (2 m) to facilitate garbage collection and removal. Its area shall be determined according to the number of containers, which is directly proportional to the holding's area. It must have an entrance from within the holding and an entrance from outside, in accordance with the requirements of the concerned authorities, and it shall not be calculated as part of the total building percentage.
2- Heights: –
a- The building shall be single-story only.
b- The maximum height of buildings is as follows: –
1. The maximum building height is (5 m).
2. Barns and buildings related to barns, with a maximum height of (10 m).
3. Workshops and stores, with a maximum height of (10 m).
3- Building Setbacks: –

### 4- Required Documents:
a- Lease contract from the State Properties Department <orig>إدارة أملاك الدولة</orig>.
b- Provide a valid rent receipt.
c- Submission of a plan approved by the Public Authority for Agriculture Affairs and Fish Resources <orig>الهيئة العامة لشؤون الزراعة والثروة السمكية</orig> through an engineering office licensed by the Municipality <orig>البلدية</orig>.
d- Written approval from the Public Authority for Agriculture Affairs and Fish Resources <orig>الهيئة العامة لشؤون الزراعة والثروة السمكية</orig>.
e- Approval of the plans by the General Fire Force <orig>قوة الإطفاء العام</orig>.
f- Electricity shall not be connected to the buildings until a letter is provided from the Public Authority for Agriculture Affairs and Fish Resources <orig>الهيئة العامة لشؤون الزراعة والثروة السمكية</orig>.

## Third: Plots for Breeding Purebred Arabian Horses:
These are plots designated for breeding purebred Arabian horses, with the area of each plot not exceeding (10,000 m2) ten thousand square meters.

### 1- Building Percentages:
a- The permitted building percentage is (15%) of the plot area, distributed as follows:
1. The following buildings:
    - Administration.
    - Workers' accommodation.
    - Electricity room.
    - Guardhouse.
    - Fodder store.
    - A rest house not exceeding 200 m2 in area.
2. A horse showroom with an area not exceeding (500 m2), which is included in the total percentage.

b- A stable divided into stalls is permitted, with each stall measuring (4 m x 4 m), provided that the number of stalls does not exceed (30). It shall be covered with a roof of light materials and its height shall not exceed (7 m) for ventilation and heat reduction. This is not included in the total building percentage.

c- A paddock for horse training is permitted, with an area not exceeding (2500 m2), made of light materials and without a roof. This is not included in the total building percentage.

d- A special circular horse walker (walker) with a diameter not exceeding (22 m) and an area not exceeding (400 m2) is permitted. It may be covered with a roof of light materials and is not included in the total building percentage.

e- An area must be allocated for garbage container collection within the holding's boundaries, adjacent to the fence on the side of a service street. It must be aesthetically fenced to a height not exceeding (2 m) to facilitate garbage collection and removal. Its area shall be determined according to the number of containers, which is directly proportional to the holding's area. It must have an entrance from within the holding and an entrance from outside, in accordance with the requirements of the concerned authorities, and is not included in the total building percentage.

### 2- Building Setbacks:
Buildings may be constructed on the plot boundaries on all sides, provided that no doors or windows open onto neighboring properties, except for the side facing the main facade, where building on the plot line is permitted for a length not exceeding (50%) of its length. The area designated for container collection is excluded from this.

### 3- Heights:
a- All buildings shall be of one story only.
b- The heights shall be as follows:
1. The height shall not exceed (5 m) five meters for buildings (administration – workers' accommodation – electricity room – guardhouse – rest house).
2. The height shall not exceed (7 m) seven meters for (horse showroom – stable – fodder store).
3. The height shall not exceed (4 m) four meters for the circular horse walker.

### 4- Required Documents:
a- Lease contract from State Properties <orig>أملاك الدولة</orig>.
b- A valid rent receipt.
c- Submission of a plan approved by the Public Authority for Agriculture Affairs and Fish Resources <orig>الهيئة العامة لشؤون الزراعة والثروة السمكية</orig> through an engineering office licensed by the Municipality <orig>البلدية</orig>.
d- Approval of the plans by the General Fire Force <orig>قوة الإطفاء العام</orig>.
e- Approval from the Environment Public Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة للبيئة</orig>.
f- Electricity shall not be connected to the buildings until approval is provided from the Public Authority for Agriculture Affairs and Fish Resources <orig>الهيئة العامة لشؤون الزراعة والثروة السمكية</orig>.

## Fourth: Livestock Production Project Plots in the Kabd <orig>كبد</orig>, Al-Jahra <orig>الجهراء</orig>, and Al-Wafra <orig>الوفرة</orig> Areas:
These are plots allocated by the Public Authority for Agriculture Affairs and Fish Resources <orig>الهيئة العامة لشؤون الزراعة والثروة السمكية</orig> for raising cattle, livestock, and camels, with areas ranging between 1250 m2 and 2500 m2.

### 1- Building Percentage:
a- Building is permitted as follows:
1. Buildings for accommodation, stores, a veterinary room, a guard's room, and their services, with a total percentage of (16%) of the plot area, up to a maximum of (300 m2).
2. The remaining open space shall be utilized for the purpose for which the plot is designated. It may not be built upon, and only shades for animals may be constructed, provided that the shaded portion does not exceed a total of 40%.

b- The remaining open areas may be cultivated.

c- The building may not be used for any purpose other than that for which the plot is designated.

e- An area must be allocated for garbage container collection within the plot's boundaries, adjacent to the fence on the side of a service street. It must be aesthetically fenced to a height not exceeding (2 m) to facilitate garbage collection and removal. Its area shall be determined according to the number of containers, which is directly proportional to the plot's area. It must have an entrance from within the plot and an entrance from outside, in accordance with the requirements of the concerned authorities, and is not included in the total building percentage.

## 2- Heights: -
The building shall be constructed of one floor only, and the maximum building height shall not exceed (5m).

## 3- Building Setbacks: -
Construction is permitted on the plot boundaries without setbacks from the street and neighbors, provided that no doors or windows are opened facing the neighbors.

## 4- Required Documents: -
a- Lease contract from the State Properties Department.
b- A valid lease receipt.
c- Submission of a plan approved by the Public Authority for Agriculture Affairs and Fish Resources <orig>الهيئة العامة لشؤون الزراعة والثروة السمكية</orig> through an engineering office licensed by the Municipality <orig>البلدية</orig>.
d- Written approval from the Public Authority for Agriculture Affairs and Fish Resources <orig>الهيئة العامة لشؤون الزراعة والثروة السمكية</orig>.
e- Approval of the plans by the General Fire Force <orig>قوة الإطفاء العام</orig>.
f- Electricity shall not be connected to the buildings until a letter is provided from the Public Authority for Agriculture Affairs and Fish Resources <orig>الهيئة العامة لشؤون الزراعة والثروة السمكية</orig>.

# Fifth: Plots for Broiler and Laying Hen Farming in all areas of Kuwait <orig>الكويت</orig>: -

## 1- Building Percentages:
a- The building percentage shall be as follows: -
1. (5%) for worker housing and its services, and an egg hatchery building.
2. (5%) for a feed store and a store for machinery and tools specific to the plot.

b- Sheds made of light materials are permitted for the production and raising of broiler chickens, according to the specifications of the Public Authority for Agriculture Affairs and Fish Resources <orig>الهيئة العامة لشؤون الزراعة والثروة السمكية</orig>, as follows: -
1. The width of the shed shall not be less than (12m) and not more than (14m).
2. The length of the shed shall not be less than (50m) and not more than (120m).
3. The distance between one shed and another shall not be less than (15m) on all sides.
4. A poultry slaughterhouse (abattoir) is permitted for broiler chicken plots within the plot boundaries, subject to the approval of the Public Authority for Agriculture Affairs and Fish Resources <orig>الهيئة العامة لشؤون الزراعة والثروة السمكية</orig> and in accordance with the technical and health specifications for chicken slaughterhouses. A cold storage and freezing warehouse for poultry meat is permitted with an area not exceeding 500 square meters, which shall be calculated as part of the 5% mentioned in item 2 above.

c- Sheds made of light materials are permitted for raising laying hens, according to the specifications of the Public Authority for Agriculture Affairs and Fish Resources <orig>الهيئة العامة لشؤون الزراعة والثروة السمكية</orig>, as follows: -
1. The sheds shall be in a system of (1 to 3 sheds) according to the farming system for laying hens, such that the first shed is for brooding and rearing, and the other three sheds are for table egg production.
2. The first shed (for brooding and rearing) shall be at a distance of no less than (350m) from the three production sheds.
3. The distance between each of the three production sheds shall not be less than (20m) on all sides.
4. A shed for an egg collection center and refrigerators for egg storage is permitted near the production sheds, at a distance of no less than (15m) from the three production sheds.

d- An area must be allocated for the purpose of collecting garbage containers within the plot boundaries, adjacent to the fence on the side of a service street. It must be aesthetically fenced to a height not exceeding (2m) to facilitate garbage collection and removal. Its area shall be determined according to the number of containers, which is directly proportional to the plot area. It must have an entrance from inside the plot and an entrance from outside, in accordance with the requirements of the concerned authorities, and it shall not be calculated as part of the total building percentage.

## 2- Setbacks: -
a- The building setback on all sides must not be less than 10m, or as per the requirements of the Public Authority for Agriculture Affairs and Fish Resources <orig>الهيئة العامة لشؤون الزراعة والثروة السمكية</orig>.
b- Construction without setbacks is permitted for worker housing and storage buildings, provided that no doors or windows are opened to the outside. The area designated for container collection is permitted to be placed on the plot boundary.

## 3- Heights: -
a- All buildings shall be of one floor only.
b- The maximum height of the buildings is as follows: -
1. Worker housing and services (5m).
2. Feed and tool stores (8m).
3. Production and rearing sheds shall not be less than (3.5m) and not more than (5m).

## 4- Required Documents: -
a- Lease contract from the State Properties.
b- A valid lease receipt.
c- Submission of a plan approved by the Public Authority for Agriculture Affairs and Fish Resources <orig>الهيئة العامة لشؤون الزراعة والثروة السمكية</orig> through an engineering office licensed by the Municipality <orig>البلدية</orig>.
d- Approval of the plans by the General Fire Force <orig>قوة الإطفاء العام</orig>.
e- Approval from the Environment Public Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة للبيئة</orig>.
f- Approval from the Public Authority for Food and Nutrition <orig>الهيئة العامة للغذاء والتغذية</orig> in the case of a slaughterhouse.
g- Electricity shall not be connected to the buildings until an approval is provided from the Public Authority for Agriculture Affairs and Fish Resources <orig>الهيئة العامة لشؤون الزراعة والثروة السمكية</orig>.

# Sixth: Service Plots Located in Block No. (10) in the Al-Wafra <orig>الوفرة</orig> Agricultural Area.
1- The area of the plots shall be a minimum of (500 m2) and a maximum of (5000 m2), to be distributed to unions, associations, and companies.

2- The plots shall be utilized - in accordance with the resolutions issued by the Municipal Council regarding their regulation - for the following activities:
a- Marketing of seeds, seedlings, and agricultural products.
b- Rental and repair of agricultural equipment and machinery.
c- Industries related to agricultural activities are as follows:
- Sorting, collecting, packaging, and canning of agricultural products.
- Manufacturing of packages and cartons.
- Pressing of dates and manufacturing of dairy products.
- Equipment for poultry, fish, and bee farms.
- Sale of agricultural supplies, irrigation tools, and pesticides.
Only one commercial license is permitted to be issued to the business owner according to the activity for which the plot is designated.

3- Building Ratios:
The maximum building area is (60%) of the plot area, of which an area not exceeding (100m2) shall be used as administrative offices to serve the plot.

4- Setbacks:
The building setback shall not be less than (5m) from the service road and (3m) from other streets. Adjoining construction is permitted on all other sides, provided that no doors or windows are opened facing the neighbors.

5- Heights:
The building shall consist of one floor only and its height shall not exceed (10m).

Seventh: Racehorse (Stables) and Camel Breeding Areas in all regions of Kuwait:
1- Building Ratios:
The building ratio shall not exceed (50%) of the plot area, as follows:
a- Horse stables (banajer) with an area of not less than (20%) of the plot area.
b- One rest house only + an office for the owner, with an area not exceeding (15%) of the plot area.
c- Services (storeroom + kitchen + bathrooms + guard's room, etc.) with an area not exceeding (15%) of the plot area.
d- An area must be allocated for the purpose of collecting garbage containers within the plot's boundaries, adjacent to the fence on one of the service streets. It must be aesthetically fenced to a height not exceeding (2m) to facilitate garbage collection and removal. Its area shall be determined according to the number of containers, which is directly proportional to the plot area. It must have an entrance from inside the plot and an entrance from outside, in accordance with the requirements of the concerned authorities, and it shall not be included in the total building ratio.

2- Heights:
- The building shall consist of a ground floor only.
- The maximum building height is (6m).

3- Setbacks:
Buildings may be constructed on the plot boundaries on all sides, provided that no doors or windows are opened facing the neighbors, with the exception of entrances and exits, where building on the plot boundary is permitted up to a maximum of (50%) of its length. The area designated for garbage container collection is excluded from this.

4- Required Documents:
a- A lease contract from the State Properties Department <orig>إدارة أملاك الدولة</orig>.
b- A valid rent receipt.
c- Submission of a plan approved by the Public Authority for Sport <orig>الهيئة العامة للرياضة</orig> through an engineering office licensed by the Municipality.
d- Written approval from the Public Authority for Sport <orig>الهيئة العامة للرياضة</orig>.
e- Approval of the plans by the General Fire Force <orig>قوة الإطفاء العام</orig>.
f- Electricity shall not be connected to the buildings until a letter is brought from the Public Authority for Sport <orig>الهيئة العامة للرياضة</orig>.

Eighth: Shop Locations in the Al-Abdali <orig>العبدلي</orig> and Al-Wafra <orig>الوفرة</orig> areas:
These are the locations under the supervision of the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig> and allocated to the Kuwaiti Farmers' Union <orig>الاتحاد الكويتي للمزارعين</orig> to provide agricultural supplies and services to its members, and they are utilized for the following activities:
- Repair of electrical equipment.
- Retail sale of sanitary ware and their extensions.
- Retail sale of building materials.
- Maintenance, repair, and replacement of light vehicle tires (tire shop).
- Maintenance, repair, and replacement of heavy vehicle tires (tire shop).
- Auto electrical repair.
- Auto mechanical repair.
- Agricultural materials and equipment.
- Retail sale of electrical tools and their extensions.
- Men's salon.
- Butchery.
- Manual and steam clothes cleaning and ironing.
- Repair of shoes and bags.
- Vehicle scale.
- Bicycle rental and leasing.
- Sale of natural medicinal herbs.
- Retail sale of dairy products, eggs, olives, and pickles.

# Insurance Regulation Unit
## Resolution No. (14) of 2025
### Regarding Approval of Final Cessation

The Chairman of the Supreme Committee of the Insurance Regulation Unit:
Having reviewed:
- Law No. (125) of 2019 regarding the regulation of insurance, its executive regulations, and their amendments,
- And Ministerial Resolution No. (215) of 2019 regarding the regulation of the actuarial expert profession,
- And Resolution No. (14) of 2022 regarding applications for issuing licenses to practice insurance activities and insurance-related professions,
- And Resolution No. (22) of 2022 regarding the licensing of companies that have regularized their status in accordance with the law, its executive regulations, and their amendments,
- And based on the request submitted by Mr. / Mohamed Ali Sayed Ibrahim <orig>محمد علي سيد ابراهيم</orig> on 12/03/2025,
- And based on the request submitted by Gulf Insurance and Reinsurance Company <orig>شركة الخليج للتأمين وإعادة التأمين</orig> on 19/03/2025,
- And based on the meeting of the Supreme Committee of the Insurance Regulation Unit No. (5) of 2025 held on 25/6/2025,

Has decided the following:
**Article One**
Approval of the request to cancel the practicing license of Mr. / Mohamed Ali Sayed Ibrahim <orig>محمد علي سيد ابراهيم</orig>, an actuarial expert – a natural person – an employee of Gulf Insurance and Reinsurance Company <orig>شركة الخليج للتأمين وإعادة التأمين</orig>.

**Article Two**
The competent authorities shall implement this resolution, each within its jurisdiction. It shall come into effect from the date of its issuance and shall be published in the Official Gazette.

Chairman of the Supreme Committee
Mohammed Sulaiman Al-Otaibi <orig>محمد سليمان العتيبي</orig>

Issued on: June 30, 2025# Resolution No. (16) of 2025

# Decision No. (15) of 2025
## Concerning the Issuance of Practice Licenses in Accordance with the Law, its Executive Regulations, and their Amendments

The Chairman of the Supreme Committee of the Insurance Regulatory Unit:
Having reviewed:
- Law No. (125) of 2019 concerning the Regulation of Insurance, its executive regulations, and their amendments,
- Ministerial Decision No. (215) of 2019 concerning the regulation of the actuarial expert profession,
- Decision No. (14) of 2022 concerning applications for issuing licenses to practice insurance activities and insurance-related professions,
- And based on the meeting of the Supreme Committee of the Insurance Regulatory Unit No. (5) of 2025, held on 25/6/2025.

Has decided the following:
### Article One
The entities that have regularized their status, as detailed in this article, are licensed to practice the following activities:

<table_caption>Licensed Actuarial Professionals and Entities</table_caption>
<table>
| No. | Licensee Name | Entity Classification | Licensed Activities |
|---|---|---|---|
| 1 | Mr. Mohamed Ma'rouf Mousa Al-Sayed <orig>السيد/ محمد معروف موسى السيد</orig> | Individual Actuarial Expert | Insurance Professions - Actuarial Expert (employee of the Kuwait Reinsurance Company) |
| 2 | Ramara MENA Actuarial Expert Company <orig>شركة رامارا مينا للخبير الإكتواري</orig> | Corporate Actuarial Expert | Insurance Professions - Actuarial Expert |
</table>

The duration of the license to practice the activity shall be (three years), commencing from the date of issuance of this decision. The aforementioned entities are obligated to pay the prescribed fees for granting the practice license, or upon its renewal for any other period, in accordance with Law No. (125) of 2019 concerning the Regulation of Insurance, its executive regulations, and their amendments, and the decisions and circulars issued by the Unit in this regard.

### Article Two
The competent authorities shall implement this decision, each within its jurisdiction. It shall be effective from the date of its issuance and shall be published in the Official Gazette.

Issued on: 30 June 2025 AD

**Chairman of the Supreme Committee**
**Mohammed Suleiman Al-Otaibi <orig>محمد سليمان العتيبي</orig>**

# Diwan of His Highness the Crown Prince <orig>ديوان سمو ولي العهد</orig>
## Announcement

The Diwan of His Highness the Crown Prince <orig>ديوان سمو ولي العهد</orig> announces Tender No. (4 / 2025 – 2026) concerning the provision of maintenance, technical support, and warranty services for the wireless network at the Diwan of His Highness the Crown Prince. Specialized companies/institutions in this field are invited to visit the Procurement and Contracts Department (Contracts and Tenders Section) at the Diwan of His Highness the Crown Prince (Bayan Palace – Administrative Building – Third Floor – ZONE 5) to obtain the documents for this tender for a fee of (50 K.D.), only fifty Kuwaiti Dinars, to be paid via (K-Net). Owners of small and medium enterprises are exempt from this fee, provided they present proof thereof. They must bring a copy of the tender announcement from the Official Gazette (Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig>) and the following documents:
Registration receipt with the Diwan of His Highness the Crown Prince <orig>ديوان سمو ولي العهد</orig> for the fiscal year 2025 – 2026.
Or
1. A copy of the license from the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>.
2. A copy of the Commercial Register.
3. A copy of the Civil ID for the establishment or company.
4. A copy of the company's Articles of Association (if any).
5. A copy of a valid registration certificate from the Kuwait Chamber of Commerce and Industry <orig>غرفة تجارة وصناعة الكويت</orig>.
6. A copy of a valid registration receipt from the Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig>.
7. A copy of a valid registration receipt from the Central Agency for Information Technology <orig>الجهاز المركزي لتكنولوجيا المعلومات</orig>.
8. A copy of the authorized signatory's signature specimen for the tenderer.
9. A valid certificate from the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig> regarding the national labor percentage.

# Article (55) of the Public Tenders Law and its amendments
- Closing date for submitting bids is no later than (1:00) PM of the tender announcement date
- Bidders wishing to participate in this tender must abide by the CAPT’s instructions published on the CAPT’s website– www.capt.gov.kw
- Bids must be submitted on a compact disc (CD/ DVD) with (5) non-modifiable copies, with an exception to the form of tenders and the bid bond to be submitted as hard copies indivisible.
- Tenders documents fees must be paid by certified cheque or Knet card
- Inquiries and clarifications by bidders who paid the tender documents fees must be provided to the relevant public authority at the time and place specified above with a schedule for the pre-tender meeting (inquiry session), any inquiries or clarifications submitted directly to the CAPT will not be consider
- A valid certificate of national manpower quota issued by the Public Authority for Manpower must be submitted with the bid, and a ‘To Whom It may concern certificate’ stating no hold applicable on the bidder file
- Owners of small and medium enterprises must be present a valid support documents issued by the National Fund for Small and Medium Enterprises prior to the settlement of the tender document fees and to be submitted with their bids

This announcement is considered as an invitation to bidders to attend the bids envelops opening session after prior coordination with the CAPT before the designated date presenting the following documents
> ➤ Copy of the civil ID
> ➤ A copy of the signature approval form issued by of the Central Agency for Public Tenders.
> ➤ Letter to be signed by the authorize individual at Central Agency for Public Tenders to attend the session.

- This announcement is considered to be a part of the public tender documents

**Secretary General**
**Central Agency for Public Tenders**
