# Kuwait Aviation Services Company (K.S.C.) Closed <orig>الشركة الكويتية لخدمات الطيران (ش.م.ك) مقفلة</orig>

## Announcement
## Regarding Public Tender No. (2025/13)
## For the Operation, Maintenance, and Repair of Engineering Services for the Buildings of Kuwait Aviation Services Company

Kuwait Aviation Services Company (K.S.C. Closed) <orig>الشركة الكويتية لخدمات الطيران (ش.م.ك مقفلة)</orig> announces the issuance of a tender for the operation, maintenance, and repair of engineering services for the buildings and facilities of Kuwait Aviation Services Company. This tender is open to specialized companies with extensive experience, classified by the Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig> (in Category Two for Air Conditioning and Category Two for Electrical Works), with the additional requirement of being classified in Category One by the Fire Force <orig>قوة الإطفاء</orig> (for firefighting and fire alarm systems), in accordance with the technical conditions and specifications detailed in the tender documents, as follows:

<table_caption>Tender Schedule for Kuwait Aviation Services Company</table_caption>
<table>
| Tender | Purchase Date | Deadline for Submission of Bids |
| :--- | :--- | :--- |
| | From | To |
| Public Tender No. (2025/13) for the Operation, Maintenance, and Repair of Engineering Services for the Buildings of Kuwait Aviation Services Company | 2025/07/06 | 2025/07/13 | 2025/07/27 (12:00 PM) |
</table>

The tender documents, which include the general and special technical specifications and conditions, category schedules, diagrams, and price analysis tables, are available on a compact disc (CD) and can be purchased from the office of the Secretary of the Tenders Committee <orig>أمين سر لجنة المناقصات</orig> at the company's administration building located in the Dajeej <orig>الضجيج</orig> area (opposite the Kuwait Airways building) during official working hours. Please note that the purchase price of the tender documents is non-refundable and must be paid to the Treasurer <orig>أمين الصندوق</orig> at the company's headquarters. The payment receipt should be included with the bid documents and placed in a sealed envelope, taking into account the following conditions:

- The bidder's capital must not be less than KWD 5,000,000 (five million Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>).
- The bidder is required to attach the original preliminary bid bond to their bid, in the form of a bank guarantee or a certified check for the amount of KWD 30,000 (thirty thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>). The preliminary bid bond must be valid for the entire duration of the bid's validity (specified as a period of at least 90 days, starting from the date set for the submission of bids).

Please be advised that a preliminary meeting for companies participating in the tender will be held on Thursday, 2025/07/17, at 11:00 AM in the meeting room at the main headquarters of Kuwait Aviation Services Company in the Dajeej <orig>الضجيج</orig> area. In the event a bidder does not attend this meeting, they will be considered fully bound by all discussions that took place and all items and decisions contained in the minutes.

For inquiries, please call the following telephone number: Switchboard: 24375500, extensions 5739, 5671.

# The Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig>

## Announcement
Regarding the issuance of Public Practice No. (A.D./M/804) Maintenance of Microsoft Dynamics Systems

The Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig> announces the issuance of Practice No. (A.D./M/804) for the maintenance of Microsoft DYNAMICS systems. Companies or institutions specialized in this field who wish to participate may obtain the terms and documents of the practice during official working hours from (The Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig> – Bayan Palace <orig>قصر بيان</orig> – Administrative Building – Tenders and Follow-up Department <orig>إدارة المناقصات والمتابعة</orig>). This will be available during official working hours starting from the date of this announcement's publication in the Official Gazette (Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig>) for a non-refundable fee of KWD 75/- (seventy-five Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only) for the documents (payment via K-Net only). Documents can be collected starting from Sunday, 2025/7/6, from 8:30 AM to 1:30 PM, taking into account the following:

1- The deadline for submitting bids is 1:30 PM on Thursday, 2025/7/17. No bids will be accepted after this time.

# Council of Ministers <orig>مجلس الوزراء</orig>
## Correction
A material error occurred in the name listed in sequence number (60) of Article One of Decree No. 203 of 2024 regarding the withdrawal of Kuwaiti nationality from certain individuals, published in Issue No. (1714) of the Official Gazette (Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig>) dated 24/11/2024.
Where it was incorrectly stated:
((60- Laila Walid Wasif Al-Ghalayini <orig>ليلى وليد واصف الغلاييني</orig>))
The correct name is:
((60- Layali Walid Wasif Al-Ghalayini <orig>ليالي وليد واصف الغلاييني</orig>))
Therefore, this notice is issued.

# Faith Capital Holding Company
## Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting
## No. (1/2025)

The Extraordinary General Assembly of Faith Capital Holding Company (K.S.C. Closed) met in the main meeting room at the company's headquarters located in Kuwait City, Abdullah Al-Mubarak Street, Al Hamra Business Tower, 65th Floor, Faith Capital Holding Company, via the Zoom meeting program at exactly 11:30 AM on Tuesday, 24/06/2025. The meeting was attended by Mr. Mohammed Bandar Al-Hawas <orig>محمد بندر الحواس</orig> representing the Gulf Company for Securities Custody <orig>الشركة الخليجية لحفظ الأوراق المالية</orig>, and Mr. Mohammed Nabil Khalid Jafar <orig>محمد نبيل خالد جعفر</orig> representing the shareholders. The meeting was chaired by Mr. Mohammed Nabil Jafar <orig>محمد نبيل جعفر</orig>, Vice Chairman of the Board of Directors and Chief Executive Officer. After the legal quorum for the validity of the meeting was declared, with 100% of the company's shares in attendance, the items on the submitted agenda were discussed, and the following was approved:

1- Approval to cancel the Extraordinary General Assembly meeting held on May 15, 2024, and the resulting annotation in the Commercial Register dated 11/09/2024.
2- Approval to increase the company's authorized, issued, and paid-up capital from KWD 4,500,000 (only four million five hundred thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>) to KWD 7,773,000 (only seven million seven hundred seventy-three thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>), by an amount of KWD 3,273,000 (only three million two hundred seventy-three thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>) by converting the credit balances of the current shareholders into new shares at a nominal value of (100 Kuwaiti Fils) per share, and to authorize the Board of Directors to set the rules and conditions for the capital call.
3- Amending Article No. (8) of the Memorandum of Association and Article No. (5) of the Articles of Association as follows:

**Current text before amendment: (According to the annotation in the Commercial Register dated 11/09/2024).**
The company's authorized and issued capital is set at KWD 7,773,000 (only seven million seven hundred seventy-three thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>), divided into 77,730,000 shares (only seventy-seven million seven hundred thirty thousand shares) with a nominal value of (100 Kuwaiti Fils) per share, and all shares are in cash.
The company's paid-up capital is set at KWD 4,500,000 (only four million five hundred thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>), divided into 45,000,000 shares (only forty-five million shares) with a nominal value of (100 Kuwaiti Fils) per share, and all shares are in cash.

**Proposed text after amendment:**
The company's authorized, issued, and paid-up capital is set at KWD 7,773,000 (only seven million seven hundred seventy-three thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>), divided into 77,730,000 shares (only seventy-seven million seven hundred thirty thousand shares) with a nominal value of (100 Kuwaiti Fils) per share, and all shares are in cash.

The meeting concluded at 12:00 PM.
Accordingly, the minutes of the meeting were signed.

Vice Chairman of the Board of Directors

# Gulf Inspection International Co. K.S.C. (Closed) <orig>شركة الخليج للتفتيش الدولية ش.م.ك (مقفلة)</orig>
## Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting
The Extraordinary General Assembly of Gulf Inspection International Co. K.S.C. (Closed) was held at 12:30 p.m. on Monday, 16/06/2025, at the company's headquarters in Subhan <orig>صبحان</orig>, Block 6, Plot 57, Street 61, in the presence of:
1) Mr. / Jassem Mohammed Hussein Qabazard <orig>جاسم محمد حسين قبازرد</orig>, Chairman of the Board of Directors of Gulf Inspection International Co.
2) Mr. / Mohammed Adel Al-Waqayan <orig>محمد عادل الوقيان</orig>, representing the Gulf Custody Company <orig>الشركة الخليجية لحفظ الأوراق المالية</orig>.
After announcing that the legal quorum was met, with shareholder attendance reaching 86.8924% of the total shares.
The topics were then discussed as per the agenda, and the following resolutions were passed by unanimous approval:
1- Approval of amending the text of Article 14 of the company's Articles of Association to appoint an independent member to the company's Board of Directors:
Text before amendment:
The company shall be managed by a Board of Directors composed of five members elected by the General Assembly by secret ballot.
Text after amendment:
The company shall be managed by a Board of Directors composed of five members elected by the General Assembly by secret ballot. The Board of Directors may include one or more independent members with experience and competence, selected by the Ordinary General Assembly, whose remuneration shall be determined in accordance with governance rules, provided that their number does not exceed half of the Board members. It is not required for an independent member to be a shareholder in the company.
2- Approval of amending the text of Article 25 of the company's Articles of Association to appoint an independent member to the company's Board of Directors:
Text before amendment:
Without prejudice to the provisions of the Commercial Companies Law, the Ordinary General Assembly shall determine the remuneration of the members of the Board of Directors, and the Board of Directors shall determine the remuneration of the managing members of the Board of Directors and the salary of the General Manager.
Text after amendment:
Without prejudice to the provisions of the Commercial Companies Law, the Ordinary General Assembly shall determine the remuneration of the members of the Board of Directors and the independent members, and the Board of Directors or the Chairman of the Board of Directors shall determine the total remuneration allocated to the departments and employees of the company.
Chairman of the Board of Directors

Second: (2%) shall be deducted for the account of the Kuwait Foundation for the Advancement of Sciences <orig>مؤسسة الكويت للتقدم العلمي</orig>.
Third: A percentage shall be deducted for the voluntary reserve account, as proposed by the Board of Directors and approved by the General Assembly. This deduction may be suspended by a resolution of the Ordinary General Assembly based on a proposal from the Board of Directors.
Fourth: A portion of the profits shall be deducted, based on a proposal by the Board of Directors and a resolution by the General Assembly, to meet the company's obligations under labor laws. These funds may not be distributed to shareholders.
Fifth: The amount necessary to distribute a first dividend of (5%) five percent to the shareholders shall be deducted, as determined by the Board of Directors and resolved by the General Assembly.
Sixth: After the foregoing, an amount resolved by the Ordinary General Assembly, not exceeding (10%) ten percent of the remainder, shall be deducted for the remuneration of the Board of Directors.
- Proposed Text (After Amendment)
The net profits shall be distributed as follows:
First: (10%) ten percent shall be deducted for the statutory reserve account. The General Assembly may suspend this deduction if the statutory reserve exceeds half of the company's capital.
Second: (1%) shall be deducted for the account of the Kuwait Foundation for the Advancement of Sciences <orig>مؤسسة الكويت للتقدم العلمي</orig>.
Third: A percentage shall be deducted for the voluntary reserve account, as proposed by the Board of Directors and approved by the General Assembly. This deduction may be suspended by a resolution of the Ordinary General Assembly based on a proposal from the Board of Directors.
Fourth: A portion of the profits shall be deducted, based on a proposal by the Board of Directors and a resolution by the General Assembly, to meet the company's obligations under labor laws. These funds may not be distributed to shareholders.

Sixth: After the foregoing, an amount resolved by the Ordinary General Assembly, not exceeding (10%) ten percent of the remainder, shall be deducted for the remuneration of the Board of Directors.
The shareholders approved this amendment with a 100% majority of those present.

K.S.C.) on Monday, 21/04/2024, at 3:00 PM at the company's headquarters located in Sharq, Khalid Ibn Al-Walid Street, Al-Jawhara Tower, in the meeting hall on the 19th floor.

In the presence of Mr. Mohammed Mahmoud Dikson <orig>محمد محمود دكسن</orig> (Chairman of the Board of Directors).
And in the presence of shareholders holding, in person and by proxy, a percentage of (97%) of the company's total share capital.

Mr. Mohammed Mahmoud Dikson <orig>محمد محمود دكسن</orig> chaired the meeting. After reviewing the invitation procedures and the attendance sheet, the Chairman of the meeting announced that the legal quorum for the validity of the meeting was met, with the attendance of shareholders holding 97% of the company's total share capital of (10,000,000 shares). He welcomed the attendees and then began discussing the agenda of the company's Extraordinary General Assembly, where the agenda items were unanimously approved as follows:

First Item: Discussion and voting on the amendment of Article 26 of the Memorandum of Association:
The shareholders discussed the Board of Directors' recommendations to amend Article 26 of the Memorandum of Association, which states that "The company shall be managed by a Board of Directors composed of five members, and the term of membership shall be three years, renewable. If the election of a new Board of Directors is not possible on the specified date, the existing Board shall continue to manage the business until the reasons preventing the election are resolved and a new Board of Directors is elected."
The shareholders agreed to amend the article to be as follows: "The company shall be managed by a Board of Directors composed of three members, and the term of membership shall be three years, renewable. If the election of a new Board of Directors is not possible on the specified date, the existing Board shall continue to manage the business until the reasons preventing the election are resolved and a new Board of Directors is elected."

Second Item: Discussion and voting on the amendment of Article 32 of the Articles of Association:
The shareholders discussed the Board of Directors' recommendations to amend Article 32 of the Memorandum of Association, which states that "A meeting of the Board of Directors shall not be valid unless attended by half of the members, provided that the number of attendees is not less than three. A higher percentage or number may be agreed upon. Meetings may be held using modern means of communication, and resolutions may be passed by circulation with the approval of all board members. The Board of Directors must meet at least six times during a single year, and a greater number of meetings may be agreed upon."
The shareholders agreed to amend the article to be as follows: "A meeting of the Board of Directors shall not be valid unless attended by half of the members, provided that the number of attendees is not less than two. A higher percentage or number may be agreed upon. Meetings may be held using modern means of communication, and resolutions may be passed by circulation with the approval of all board members.
The Board of Directors must meet at least six times during a single year, and a greater number of meetings may be agreed upon."

Upon completion of the review of the Ordinary General Assembly's agenda items, the Chairman thanked the attendees and praised the efforts made in working towards the success and progress of the company. He resolved to conclude the meeting with the resolutions passed, at 4:00 PM on the same day.

Chairman of the Board of Directors

# Kuwait Commercial Markets Complex Company K.S.C.P. <orig>شركة مجمعات الأسواق التجارية الكويتية ش.م.ك.م</orig>
## Minutes of the (Adjourned) Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting for the Fiscal Year Ended 31/12/2024

The (Adjourned) Extraordinary General Assembly of Kuwait Commercial Markets Complex Company K.S.C.P. <orig>شركة مجمعات الأسواق التجارية الكويتية ش.م.ك.م</orig> held its meeting for the fiscal year ended 31/12/2024 on Monday, 2/6/2025, at 01:30 PM at Sharq – Block 5 – Jaber Al-Mubarak Street – Plot B11 – The Commercial Real Estate Company Building – Al-Tijaria Hall – Second Floor. This was based on the invitation of the company's Board of Directors and the notification to the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> of the date of the Extraordinary General Assembly, pursuant to our letter dated 4/5/2025 and the announcements published in the daily newspapers on 11/5/2025 (Al-Anba newspaper <orig>جريدة الأنباء</orig> – Al-Rai newspaper <orig>جريدة الراي</orig>) and on 18/5/2025 (Al-Qabas newspaper <orig>جريدة القبس</orig> – Al-Jarida newspaper <orig>جريدة الجريدة</orig>).
The meeting was chaired by Mr. Hussein Abdullah Johar <orig>حسين عبد الله جوهر</orig> – Chairman of the Board of Directors. The meeting was also attended by:
On behalf of Kuwait Commercial Markets Complex Company:
- Mr. Mohamed Hamdy El-Ghaytani <orig>محمد حمدي الغيطاني</orig> – Chief Financial Officer
After auditing and reviewing all the documents and proxies of the attendees, both in person and by proxy, the Chairman of the session announced that the legal quorum for the validity of the (Adjourned) Extraordinary General Assembly meeting of Kuwait Commercial Markets Complex Company K.S.C.P. <orig>شركة مجمعات الأسواق التجارية الكويتية ش.م.ك.م</orig> for the fiscal year ended 31/12/2024 was met, with the attendance of shareholders representing 63,306,853 shares (sixty-three million, three hundred six thousand, eight hundred fifty-three shares), which constitutes an attendance rate of 67.79% of the total capital shares amounting to 93,386,016 shares (ninety-three million, three hundred eighty-six thousand, and sixteen shares).
At the beginning, Mr. Hussein Abdullah Johar <orig>حسين عبد الله جوهر</orig>, the Chairman of the session, welcomed the attending shareholders. The meeting then commenced with the presentation, discussion, and voting on the items listed on the agenda of the Adjourned Extraordinary General Assembly.
First: Approval to increase the company's authorized, issued, and paid-up capital from KWD 9,338,601/600 (only nine million, three hundred thirty-eight thousand, six hundred one Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> and 600 fils <orig>فلس</orig>) to KWD 9,805,531/700 (only nine million, eight hundred five thousand, five hundred thirty-one Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> and 700 fils <orig>فلس</orig>) by issuing 4,669,301 shares (four million, six hundred sixty-nine thousand, three hundred one shares), equivalent to KWD 466,930/100 (four hundred sixty-six thousand, nine hundred thirty Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> and 100 fils <orig>فلس</orig>), at a rate of 5%, to be distributed as free bonus shares to the shareholders registered in the company's shareholder register on the date of the General Assembly meeting, and to authorize the Board of Directors to dispose of any fractional shares, if any.
- This item was approved by the unanimous consent of the attending shareholders.
Second: Amending the text of Article (6) of the Memorandum of Association and Article (5) of the Articles of Association, after obtaining the approval of the competent authorities, to become as follows:
- **Current Text (Before Amendment)**
The company's authorized, issued, and paid-up capital is set at KWD 9,338,601/600 (nine million, three hundred thirty-eight thousand, six hundred one Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> and 600 fils <orig>فلس</orig>), divided into 93,386,016 shares (ninety-three million, three hundred eighty-six thousand, and sixteen shares) with a nominal value of 100 Kuwaiti fils (one hundred Kuwaiti fils) per share, and all shares are cash shares.

(K.S.C.) Closed

The Extraordinary General Assembly of Munshar Real Estate Company <orig>شركة منشر العقارية</orig> held its meeting on Wednesday, June 25, 2025, at 11:00 AM at the 360 Mall – Fourth Floor.
The meeting was chaired by Mr. Abdulaziz Dawood Al-Marzouq <orig>عبدالعزيز داود المرزوق</orig> – Chairman of the Board of Directors. The meeting was also attended by:
- Mr. Iyad Fayeq Abusuwayrih <orig>إياد فايق أبوسويرح</orig>, representing the office of Grant Thornton - Al-Qatami & Al-Aiban & Co. <orig>مكتب جرانت ثورنتون – القطامي والعيبان وشركاهم</orig> – the company's auditor.
- Mr. Mohammed Al-Waqayan <orig>محمد الوقيان</orig>, representing the Gulf Clearing Company <orig>الشركة الخليجية لحفظ الأوراق المالية</orig>.

The attendance of shareholders holding 250,000,000 shares by proxy was announced, representing 100% of the company's total shares. The meeting began with a discussion of the agenda as follows:
A: The Assembly unanimously approved the amendment of Article (5) of the Memorandum of Association and Article (4) of the Articles of Association as follows:

### Text Before Amendment:
Without prejudice to the provisions of the Companies Law-Decree No. 25 of 2012 <orig>المرسوم بقانون الشركات رقم 2012/25</orig> and its amendments and executive regulations, the purposes for which the company was established are:
The purposes for which the company was established are to carry out the following:
1- Owning, selling, and purchasing real estate and land and developing them for the company's account inside and outside the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>, as well as managing third-party properties, all in a manner that does not violate the provisions stipulated in existing laws and the prohibitions on trading in private housing plots as stipulated by these laws.
2- Owning, selling, and purchasing shares and bonds of real estate companies for the company's account only in Kuwait and abroad.
3- Preparing studies and providing consultations in all types of real estate fields, provided that the required conditions are met by those who practice this service.
4- Owning and managing hotels, health clubs, and tourist facilities, and leasing and renting them.
5- Carrying out maintenance work related to buildings and properties owned by the company and by others, including maintenance work and the execution of civil, mechanical, and electrical works, elevators, and air conditioning works, in a manner that ensures the preservation and safety of the buildings.
6- Managing, operating, investing in, leasing, and renting hotels, clubs, motels, guesthouses, rest houses, parks, gardens, exhibitions, restaurants, cafeterias, residential complexes, tourist and health resorts, recreational and sports projects, and shops of various grades and levels, including all original and auxiliary services, attached facilities, and other necessary services.
7- Organizing real estate exhibitions for the company's real estate projects, in accordance with the regulations in force at the Ministry.
8- Holding real estate auctions, in accordance with the regulations in force at the Ministry.
9- Owning and managing commercial markets and residential complexes.
10- Utilizing the company's available financial surpluses by investing them in financial portfolios managed by specialized companies and entities.
11- Direct contribution to establishing the infrastructure for residential, commercial, and industrial areas and projects under the "Build-Operate-Transfer" (BOT) system, and managing real estate facilities under the (BOT) system.

The company may directly carry out the aforementioned activities in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> and abroad, either as a principal or as an agent. The company may have an interest in or associate in any way with entities that carry out activities similar to its own or that may assist it in achieving its objectives in Kuwait or abroad, and it may establish, participate in, purchase, or affiliate with such entities.

### Text After Amendment:
681010 Purchase and sale of land and real estate

Regarding the Installation of Automated Teller Machines (ATM) at Land Border Crossings (Al-Salmi, Al-Nuwaisib, Al-Abdali)

The Investment Projects Department at the Ministry of Interior <orig>وزارة الداخلية</orig> announces the offering of Auction No. (M.M/2024/6-2025) (divisible) regarding the licensing of a specialized company, institution, or a local bank accredited in the State of Kuwait to provide and install Automated Teller Machines (ATM) at the land border crossings with the aim of facilitating cash withdrawal operations and carrying out other banking services provided by these machines.

Companies, institutions, and banks specialized in this field with prior experience that wish to participate in this auction should visit the Investment Projects Department at the Ministry of Interior building in the Sharq area during official working hours, starting from Monday, 2025/07/07, to obtain the booklet of general and special conditions for this auction, for a non-refundable fee of (100 K.D.).

The date for inspecting the designated service locations will be:
1- Monday, 2025/07/21 for the location: (Al-Salmi <orig>السالمي</orig> Crossing).
2- Tuesday, 2025/07/22 for the location: (Al-Nuwaisib <orig>النويصيب</orig> Crossing).
3- Wednesday, 2025/07/23 for the location: (Al-Abdali <orig>العبدلي</orig> Crossing).

A preliminary meeting for those who have obtained the conditions booklet will be held at the headquarters of the Investment Projects Department at ten o'clock in the morning on Monday, 2025/07/28.

Bids must be submitted to the Purchase Envelopes Opening Committee (Ground Floor) at the Ministry of Interior / Sharq area (formerly Al-Siddiq School). The closing date (submission of bids) is Thursday, 2025/08/14, from eight o'clock in the morning until one o'clock in the afternoon. No bids submitted before or after the specified time will be accepted.
For review and inquiries / Investment Projects Department – Telephone: 22410802

# Minutes of the Meeting of the Births and Deaths Committee <orig>لجنة المواليد والوفيات</orig>, Session No. 16/2025, held on 10/06/2025

After reviewing the applications submitted for the amendment of data in the birth and death records, the Committee has decided that if no objection is raised within fifteen days from the date of publication of this announcement, the amendment will be made in the records, and birth or death certificates will be issued according to the following amendment:

# Minutes of the Meeting of the Births and Deaths Committee <orig>لجنة المواليد والوفيات</orig>, Session No. 16/2025, held on 10/06/2025

The Births and Deaths Committee <orig>لجنة المواليد والوفيات</orig>, as stipulated in Article 15 of Law No. 36/69 and formed by Ministerial Resolution No. 1650/2021, has convened.

- Dr. / Chairman of the General Medical Council <orig>المجلس الطبي العام</orig> - Chairman
- Mr. / Director of the Central Registry of Births and Deaths Department <orig>إدارة السجل المركزي للمواليد والوفيات</orig> - Member
- Mr. / Head of the Registration Section <orig>رئيس قسم القيد</orig> - Member
- Mr. / Head of the Research and Opinion Section <orig>رئيس قسم البحوث والرأي</orig> - Member
- Mr. / Head of the Deaths Section <orig>رئيس قسم الوفيات</orig> - Member
- Mr. / Legal Researcher <orig>الباحث القانوني</orig> - Member
- Mr. / Head of the Records Section <orig>رئيس قسم السجلات</orig> - Member

The secretarial duties of the committee were performed by Ms. Alia Al-Saffar <orig>علياء الصفار</orig>.

The Committee reviewed applications from No. ((205)) to No. ((215)) in the attached list, concerning the amendment of data in the birth and death records for requests of unrecorded births and deaths. After examination and verification of the completeness of documents and records, the Committee has decided to announce the amendments and requests in the Official Gazette (Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig>) in two consecutive issues. If the legal period (fifteen days) from the date of the last announcement elapses without any objection being submitted, the amendments will be made in the registers, and the birth and death certificates will be issued.

Companies wishing to participate in the tender must meet the following conditions:
1) The company must be specialized in this field and provide proof thereof.
2) Payment of the prescribed fees for purchasing the tender documents in cash.

4) Participating companies must submit a national labor support certificate.
5) Tender documents can be obtained from the date of publication until the closing date.

## Announcement
The Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig> announces Tender No.: S/M S/11/2025/2026 for providing meals for the lecture program of the Training Department at the Medical Laboratory Services Administration for the fiscal year 2025/2026, among companies specialized in this field, in accordance with the general and special conditions specified in the tender documents, which can be obtained from the Ministry's website (www.moh.gov.kw), for a non-refundable fee of (75 K.D.), only seventy-five Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>.
It is necessary to attach a letter from the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig> when submitting the booklet, stating commitment to the National Labor Support Law in accordance with Law No. 19 of 2000 and the Council of Ministers <orig>مجلس الوزراء</orig> Decision No. 1104/Fifth for the year 2008 regarding the support and encouragement of national labor.
The closing date for the tender is at 1:00 PM on Monday, 21/07/2025, at the bid box at the aforementioned address. Bids shall be valid for a period of (90) days from the closing date. The initial bid bond is (2%), only two percent, of the bid value, valid for the entire duration of the bid's validity.
Note: Priority will be given to small and medium-sized enterprises affiliated with the National Fund for Small and Medium Enterprise Development <orig>الصندوق الوطني وتنمية المشروعات الصغيرة والمتوسطة</orig>.

## Announcement of Public Auction Sale of Seized Items

## Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig>
# Announcement
Regarding Tender No. 7 for the year 2025 concerning the supply, installation, operation, maintenance, and warranty of (devices - machines - equipment) for the cameras of the Public Authority for Industry. The Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig> announces Tender No. 7 for the year 2025 concerning the supply, installation, operation, maintenance, and warranty of (devices - machines - equipment) for the cameras of the Public Authority for Industry. These documents can be obtained by visiting the website bids.pai.gov.kw starting from the date of this announcement's publication.

<table_caption>Tender Details for Supply and Maintenance of Cameras for the Public Authority for Industry</table_caption>
<table>
| Preliminary Meeting | Initial Guarantee | Document Price | Closing Date | Issue Date |
|:---|:---|:---|:---|:---|
| None | 1500 K.D. | 75 K.D. | 20/7/2025 | 6/7/2025 |
</table>

The deadline for submitting bids is Sunday, 20/7/2025, at 12:00 PM. Bids are to be delivered to the main headquarters of the Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig> (Second Floor - Supplies and Warehouses Department - Procurement Section) in an envelope marked with the tender name. Bids shall be valid for a period of (90) days from the date of bid envelope opening.
The bidder must submit a recent "To Whom It May Concern" certificate issued by the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig> stating that there is no hold on the company's file for government contracts registered with the Public Authority for Manpower, and a "To Whom It May Concern" certificate indicating compliance with the national labor percentage, with a recent date contemporary to the bid date. The bidder must also deposit with their bid an initial guarantee in the form of a certified check or an unconditional, unreserved, and irrevocable letter of guarantee issued in the bidder's name from one of the approved banks in the State of Kuwait, in favor of the Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig>, and valid for the duration of the bid's validity. Any bid not accompanied by this full guarantee will be disqualified. The initial guarantee may not be returned until after (90) days from the tender closing date or when the winning bidder signs the contract, unless the tender is canceled. The Authority will not pay any interest on the amount of this guarantee, and the bidder's creditors may not seize its amount. Note that this tender is not divisible.

# General Presidency of the National Guard <orig>الرئاسة العامة للحرس الوطني</orig>
## Announcement of Practice No. (06- 2025/2026)
### Supply and Filling of Gas Cylinders
The General Presidency of the National Guard <orig>الرئاسة العامة للحرس الوطني</orig> announces the offering of a practice for the supply and filling of gas cylinders, open to specialized companies and institutions in accordance with the general and special conditions contained in the practice documents.
Therefore, companies and institutions wishing to participate in this practice must register on the website of the General Presidency of the National Guard (www.kng.gov.kw) to purchase the practice documents for a non-refundable fee of (75 K.D.) only seventy-five Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>. Payment is to be made through the National Guard's website via the (K-NET) service.
A preliminary meeting will be held at 10:00 AM on Sunday, (13/07/2025) at the General Presidency of the National Guard, Colonel Staff / Faisal Al-Juraid <orig>فيصل الجريد</orig> building. The practitioner, whether present or not, will be bound by all decisions, recommendations, or clarifications made during this meeting. Participating companies and institutions must also print the minutes of the preliminary meeting from the National Guard's website (www.kng.gov.kw). The deadline for submitting bids is 1:00 PM on Sunday, (20/07/2025).

## Announcement of Practice No. (05- 2025/2026)
### Supply of Building Glass and its Accessories
The General Presidency of the National Guard <orig>الرئاسة العامة للحرس الوطني</orig> announces the offering of a practice for the supply of building glass and its accessories, open to specialized companies and institutions in accordance with the general and special conditions contained in the practice documents.
Therefore, companies and institutions wishing to participate in this practice must register on the website of the General Presidency of the National Guard (www.kng.gov.kw) to purchase the practice documents for a non-refundable fee of (75 K.D.) only seventy-five Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>. Payment is to be made through the National Guard's website via the (K-NET) service.
A preliminary meeting will be held at 11:00 AM on Sunday, (13/07/2025) at the General Presidency of the National Guard, Colonel Staff / Faisal Al-Juraid <orig>فيصل الجريد</orig> building. The practitioner, whether present or not, will be bound by all decisions, recommendations, or clarifications made during this meeting. Participating companies and institutions must also print the minutes of the preliminary meeting from the National Guard's website (www.kng.gov.kw). The deadline for submitting bids is 1:00 PM on Sunday, (20/07/2025).
Note: Companies and institutions wishing to purchase the tender documents must provide us with a copy of the purchase receipt. Companies classified as small and medium enterprises must provide a certificate proving this status. For any inquiries, please call the switchboard at (24999999) extension (66735-66787), Fax (24999858).

Public Tender
The Public Authority for Housing Welfare <orig>المؤسسة العامة للرعاية السكنية</orig> announces the issuance of Tender No.: P.A.H.W / T / 1449 – 2025 / 2026 for the supply, installation, operation, maintenance, and warranty of three (3) permanent air quality monitoring stations in the residential areas affiliated with the Public Authority for Housing Welfare <orig>المؤسسة العامة للرعاية السكنية</orig> (Jaber Al-Ahmad City <orig>مدينة جابر الأحمد</orig> – West Abdullah Al-Mubarak Suburb <orig>ضاحية غرب عبد الله المبارك</orig> – Al-Qairawan Area <orig>منطقة القيروان</orig>)

<table_caption>Tender Schedule and Fees</table_caption>
<table>
| Initial Guarantee | Document Sale Price | Closing Date | Issuance Date |
|:---|:---|:---|:---|
| 20,000/- K.D. valid for (90) days | 1,000/- K.D. | 2025/08/03 | 2025/07/06 |
</table>

Local companies that have executed projects for the supply, installation, implementation, and maintenance of permanent air quality monitoring stations, and which meet the list of principles and criteria required of bidders, are invited to apply to purchase the tender documents, submitting all required documents and records in accordance with the requirements, conditions, and prescribed method.

First: Tender documents can be obtained from the Documents and Contracts Department – Third Floor – at the headquarters of the Public Authority for Housing Welfare <orig>المؤسسة العامة للرعاية السكنية</orig> – South Surra <orig>جنوب السرة</orig>, in accordance with the following conditions for purchasing the tender documents:
1. Submission of a registration certificate issued by the Commercial Register at the Ministry of Commerce <orig>وزارة التجارة</orig>, a registration certificate from the Kuwait Chamber of Commerce and Industry <orig>غرفة تجارة وصناعة الكويت</orig>, the company's articles of association, and the company's registration certificate with the Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig>. (A recent certificate for the year the tender is issued).
2. The tender documents will be handed over in exchange for a non-refundable amount as specified in the table above, payable by a certified check issued in favor of the Public Authority for Housing Welfare <orig>المؤسسة العامة للرعاية السكنية</orig> or by K-Net card <orig>بطاقة كي نت</orig>.
3. Submission of a letter of authorization from the company in the name of the person authorized to purchase the tender documents, with a copy of the authorized person's Civil ID and a signature authentication certificate attached.
4. Submission of a valid certificate of compliance with the national labor percentage issued by the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig>.
5. Submission of proof that the company has executed and completed works similar to the required tender works (taking into account the controls in the Principles and Criteria clause), along with a copy of the contract and a certificate of completion issued by the contracting entity.
6. Companies that have an active penalty in state tenders and projects will not be allowed to participate.
- The deadline for submitting inquiries about the aforementioned tender is 2025/07/20. Inquiries must be submitted in Arabic (to the Documents and Contracts Department – Third Floor – at the headquarters of the Public Authority for Housing Welfare <orig>المؤسسة العامة للرعاية السكنية</orig> – South Surra <orig>جنوب السرة</orig>). Any questions or inquiries received by the Authority after this date will not be considered.

Second: The following conditions must be adhered to when submitting the bid:
1) The deadline for submitting bids (closing) is 1:00 PM at the headquarters of the Public Authority for Housing Welfare <orig>المؤسسة العامة للرعاية السكنية</orig> – South Surra <orig>جنوب السرة</orig> – Documents and Contracts Department – Third Floor.
2) Invited and applying companies must submit a valid certificate of compliance with the national labor percentage issued by the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig> when purchasing the tender and attach it when submitting the bid.
3) The bidder must attach a clearance certificate stating that there are no impediments related to the labor registered in their file with the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig> in this regard.
4) The bidder must attach with their bid an initial guarantee in their name, in favor of the Public Authority for Housing Welfare <orig>المؤسسة العامة للرعاية السكنية</orig>, in the form of a letter of guarantee or a certified check issued in Arabic, unconditional, free of any reservations, payable on demand, issued by a bank accredited in the State of Kuwait, and valid for the entire duration of the bid's validity, for the value specified in the announcement above. The bidder is not entitled to cancel it or have it seized by their creditors, nor to claim any interest on it. Cash deposits are not accepted. Any bid not accompanied by the initial guarantee will be excluded.
5) The authorized representative of the company invited to participate in the tender (after providing proof thereof) shall place all tender documents, all required documents in full, as well as the qualification documents, in the designated envelope according to the instructions in the documents and the tender announcement, seal it with red wax, and then personally and at their own risk, place the first envelope [Bid Submission Envelope] in the designated box, which contains:
- The initial guarantee (preliminary bond).
- The two bid form sheets and the total bid value (original copies), completed, stamped, and signed.
- The national labor percentage certificate (valid).

Third: Principles and Criteria: –
The bidder must submit all required documents proving their fulfillment of all conditions and requirements of the Principles and Criteria with the bid documents, placing them inside the envelope designated for the Principles and Criteria requirements as follows: –
a. The company must have been established, or in the case of individuals, have been practicing the activity, for at least 5 years.
b. The company's capital must not be less than (250,000 K.D.) two hundred fifty thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>.
c. Companies that have an active penalty in state tenders and projects will not be allowed to participate.
d. The company applying to purchase the tender must provide one or two projects in the field of the tender's scope of work (supply, installation, operation, or maintenance of air quality monitoring stations or their related equipment), the total value of which is not less than (50,000 K.D.) fifty thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>.

Note:
- Maintenance contracts are acceptable.
- Subcontracts are acceptable provided that the contract concluded with the main contractor for similar works in government projects is submitted, along with their accreditation as a subcontractor for the same works required for the tender in the project from the owning entity, provided that the experience requirements mentioned above are met.
- It is necessary to submit copies of the contracts for the projects required above that show the project value. Certificates of completion issued by the entities with which the contracts were made to execute the works for the same projects must also be submitted.
